alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 9:10PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .A line of thunderstorms will continue moving over the same area across western Scotts Bluff County over the next hour. Moderate to very heavy rainfall will continue. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following county, Scotts Bluff. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.25 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Kiowa Creek, East Eagle Nest Draw, Tri-State Canal, Eagle Nest Draw, Dry Sheep Creek, Owl Creek, Scottsbluff Lateral, Dry Spottedtail Creek, Katzer Main Drain, Horse Creek, Mitchell and Gering Canal, North Platte River and Robb Draw. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morrill, Lyman, Stegall, Hubbard Hill and Henry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
